quest.name: Confessions of the Heart
journal: Kakalai needs your help with a matter of the heart.
objectives: Deliver Kakalai's love note to Athala.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: An adventurer. Thank the gods. I have a favor to ask, and the others would never let me live this down if they were to find out.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: I've met someone, you see, and in the most peculiar of places─on the battlefield! No, she isn't an imperial soldier, but a ravishing Resistance fighter. After asking around, it seems she's stationed near the Yawn on the path toward the Peaks.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: But in our line of work tomorrow is never a certainty. To lose her before making my feelings known would be more than my heart can bear.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: That is why I would ask you to take this letter. Take it and deliver it to my dear sweet Athala.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: My heart is still spinning from our first meeting. Please take that letter to my dear sweet Athala. She must know how I feel.

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: How can I help you, adventurer?

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: A letter from...Kakalai? <gasp> Can it be? The dashing young soldier who rescued me? I can't believe it!

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: From the moment I laid eyes on him I knew it was fate. Would you like to hear the tale of our meeting? Of two brave souls on the battlefield of love?

dialogue.name: CHOICE2Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: CHOICE2A1
dialogue.text: Nod politely while considering how to spend your tomestones.

dialogue.name: CHOICE2A2
dialogue.text: Prepare for the tale of a small man with a big heart.

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: All of my unit lay dead or dying around me, and the Garleans were closing in. The glint of their swords in the high noon sun was blinding. Despite my training, I felt infinitely small in an endless sea of carnage and chaos.

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: In all my time as a conjurer I have never struck a blow against an enemy. There was always some ploy at my disposal, a clever use of the terrain to outmaneuver my enemies. But the barren lands of Gyr Abania would afford me no such luxury.

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: I stood precariously on a knife's edge and could feel I would soon fall. I dared not look to see what was waiting for me below. My only thought was I wanted to live. I wanted to live!

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: The imperial sword came crashing down. I braced myself for the end. What filled the air next was not my cries of agony, but the sweet song of steel against steel. I then opened my eyes to an amazing sight. At first I thought it a bean sprout jumping furiously to and fro, but lo and behold, it was Kakalai!

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: I began casting healing magicks and I could not take my eyes off him. He was poetry in motion.

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: Before long the imperials all lay defeated. The only sound to be heard was his labored breathing and mine.

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: He then ran off to join the fray elsewhere, but for one moment─one magical moment─our eyes met. When I looked into those glorious emerald green eyes of his, I knew he was the one.

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: My sweet angel still lives. And to think he would send me such a letter!

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: After losing my parents twenty years ago I had always been filled with such hate, such anger. All I lived for was revenge against the Garleans.

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: But those days are done. Love has found me and I will never let it go! Here, would you take this flower to him? Tell him I would bask in his love like this blossom in sunlight.

dialogue.name: ATHALA
dialogue.text: Oh, how I long for the day when I can hold him in my arms once more.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: Did you find her? Did you deliver the note?

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: A flower?

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: A stock! They say it symbolizes the bonds of love, you know.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: My sweet, sweet Athala. Would you like to hear of how we met? Of how I came to meet an angel on the battlefield?

dialogue.name: CHOICE2Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: CHOICE2A1
dialogue.text: Nod politely while planning your escape from the conversation.

dialogue.name: CHOICE2A2
dialogue.text: Listen closely to the tale of the angel and her healing hands.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: My unit had been crushed utterly by a magitek menace set upon us by the imperials. It was all I could do to escape. I honestly had no idea where I was going. I only knew that death was at my back. Before I knew it, I was careening into a soldier, and I instinctively readied my blade.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: I defeated him with relative ease, but sadly he was not alone. More soldiers beyond counting stood before me, and a mechanical monster still giving chase behind. In that moment I grew tired of it all. Tired of running, tired of living. So I rushed headlong into the throng of soldiers.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: I swung my sword wildly, caring not for the blows they made against me. Where there should have been pain, there was only a soothing breeze blowing against my back. I felt reinvigorated, and so I kept fighting down to the last man. It was only then that I looked back.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: What I saw there behind me I can describe only as perfection. The gods must have grown jealous of her beauty and cast her down from the heavens.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: But my sweet angel was not yet free from danger. The magitek drone was still following me. So I ran before it was close enough to open fire on the both of us.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: I ran and ran until I found a support unit of the Allied forces. I was safe...and in love.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: It is unfair to say that I saved her. No, she is the one who saved me. When next we receive our wages I will have to get her something.

dialogue.name: KAKALAI
dialogue.text: A ring, perhaps...
